Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy 5  years ago, and did not have a reconstruction. I have never regretted that decision. If you don't want one, then be firm about it.
Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy 5  years ago, and did not have a reconstruction. I have never regretted that decision. If you don't want one, then be firm about it.
Posts.Title: Just had another mastectomy without reconstruction. Anyone else decided...

Posts.Content: Is there anyone else like me? I know that various scans etc. are to be planned for me, by my oncologist, and yet every time the postman comes my heart sinks in case the appointment date has come through. Yet if it doesn't come, I worry about that too! Think I am a total nutcase!!!
Posts.Title: Appointments!

Posts.Content: Yes, I would if only to put your mind at rest. Did you not initially have an ultrasound scan? I would stand firm on this, and maybe get your GP to refer you to a different hospital, as you can choose where you want to be trated. Wishing you all the very best xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: I think you are being very sensible and looking after yourself. Do let us know how you get on. I know it is a very scary time, and you need an answer one way or another. With very very best wishes xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Yes Sue. I am waiting for another CT scan. Over the last 7 years I have learnt to be proactive too!  Even so, when that envelope comes through the door ------! Thank you for replying xxx
Posts.Title: Appointments!

Posts.Content: I think you are being very sensible and looking after yourself. Do let us know how you get on. I know it is a very scary time, and you need an answer one way or another. With very very best wishes xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: Yes, I would if only to put your mind at rest. Did you not initially have an ultrasound scan? I would stand firm on this, and maybe get your GP to refer you to a different hospital, as you can choose where you want to be trated. Wishing you all the very best xxx
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??
Should I get a second opinion??
Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: I was asked what colour mine were! Then given a pair of disposable ones to wear! Obviously the colour, blue with white dots, was wrong!
Posts.Title: Modesty during surgery

Posts.Content: That is so true Baki. After 7 years of non-stop treatment, I decided to go for counselling at the hospital's Macmillan centre. Whilst I found it useful, my husband, who came with me, got an awful lot from the session. In fact, he talked more than I did! The counsellor gave me his details, and we can contact him at any time to arrange more visits.
Posts.Title: Loved ones' strange reaction

Posts.Content: I have had a port for 4 years now - 5 in December. I started with a picc line, it took ages to get in, and then only lasted for 4 sessions. It began to leak and had to come out. I have found the port so much better. I have been having treatment every 3 weeks for 5 years, and for the foreseeable future,and have had no trouble with it so far. Hope it works out well for you xx
Posts.Title: Hickman line vs Port

Posts.Content: I have never had numbing gel on my port! Will have to mention that! Actually, it doesn't hurt much at all when the needle goes in.
Posts.Title: Hickman line vs Port

Posts.Content: I have been on Kadcyla for two and a half years now, and find that at times my urine can get quite smelly. Sorry to bring this up, but has anyone else had it? Is there anything I can do about it, do you think?
Posts.Title: Smelly urine! (Sorry!)

Posts.Content: Fran, there is not a lot I can say, but (((hugs))) galore to you, and you will be in my thoughts. xxxx
Posts.Title: Update on my cancer

Posts.Content: Yes, my paclitaxel was reduced 4 years ago, because I was developing peripheral neuropathy. Now I am on Kadcyla, and have been for 2 years and 7 months. That was also reduced slightly as the neuropathy was getting worse, and Kadcyla can cause it, according to my oncologist. I was not made aware of it having a lesser effect on the cancer, so I am presuming things are much the same. All the best to you xxx
Posts.Title: Reduced dose of chemo

Posts.Content: I have been on ZA for a few years now, and if you need dental treatment you have to miss two doses. Your oncologist will tell you what to do x
Posts.Title: Bones

Posts.Content: My goodness. You are not a wimp. I have felt like that many times, and so have others. I burst into tears when I couldn't hang the washing on the line! It's OK to cry, to feel sorry for yourself and feel alone, don't worry. Things will improve, and in the meantime here's lots of (((hugs))) xx
Posts.Title: *** July 2017 Chemo Club ***
